meanings.definition: Giving a sign or warning of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were presageful of the impending storm.
meanings.sent2: Her sudden silence was presageful of bad news.
meanings.sent3: The cat's loud meowing was presageful of an empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the forest was presageful of an approaching danger.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look was presageful of a pop quiz.

meanings.definition: Serving as an omen or portent.
meanings.sent1: The black cat crossing our path felt presageful of bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The howling wind was presageful of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: Finding a four-leaf clover was presageful of good fortune.
meanings.sent4: The broken mirror was presageful of seven years of bad luck.
meanings.sent5: The owl's hoot outside the window was presageful of a visitor.

meanings.sent1: The fortune teller's words were presageful of a prosperous year ahead.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was presageful of an early winter.
meanings.sent3: The old clock striking thirteen was presageful of a time warp.
meanings.sent4: The shooting star was presageful of a wish about to come true.
meanings.sent5: The distant thunder was presageful of an approaching storm.
